title: Coding Challenges
description: 話題性を持たせるのは難しいものです。広告を出しても、コミュニティの拠点にはならないかもしれません。

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal itself is great and it would perhaps address the challenge in case more information is available. Please think about to improve the proposal by  a concrete steps, regions, plans about how many youngsters the program would draw that everyone gets better view on the project plans.
f6_assessments.q1: Please consider providing more information about what teams, personnel would work on the project execution in order that the implementation can be elaborated properly.
f6_assessments.q2: From auditing point of view, consider thinking about milestones, how the project steps would be measured and how the success of it would be defined. Once all the information will be updated the proposal can have a great future.

f6_assessments.q0: Draft proposal. There is no problem within the problem statement. There is not enough information for impact assessment. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a reference for a new proposal, more precisely the document proposal writing guide in the FAQ section on the IdeaScale Catalyst homepage.
f6_assessments.q1: Draft proposal. There is not enough information for feasibility assessment. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a reference for a new proposal, more precisely the document proposal writing guide in the FAQ section on the IdeaScale Catalyst homepage.
f6_assessments.q2: Draft proposal. There is not enough information for auditability assessment. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a reference for a new proposal, more precisely the document proposal writing guide in the FAQ section on the IdeaScale Catalyst homepage.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal lacks clarity. There isn't a clear idea in this proposal. I think it does not address the challenge effectively.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal does not contain a roadmap and a detailed plan. Informations about the team are also missing. I think that this proposal cannot be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: Due to the fact that there are  no KPIs, nor a clear roadmap, auditing this proposal can be very difficult.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal lacks specifics on how to obtain youth participation in the coding challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: Lack of experience and qualifications not presented on how this proposal will be successful.
f6_assessments.q2: No specific milestones, and very difficult to audit the progress.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to create a community for young aspiring coders could help to scale up the community, but may not bring in the skill-level required initially.
f6_assessments.q1:
Having over 15 years of experience in marketing and community engagement, I would assess that the proposal is a good idea but there is a lack of clarity on how it would be implemented and maintained. The proposer needs to give greater detail across the board.

To implement and maintain a community at the scale this proposal implies would take a large amount of work. The proposer needs to deliver a detailed project plan, including a detailed budget breakdown, resource requirements and how they would manage it going forward.

Much more detail is required on the scale and locations they want to focus on, how they would engage their audience, how they would create collateral for the courses and assess responses to challenges, the way they would maintain and moderate the community.

The ask for $100,000 will require a much more detailed breakdown of how they plan on spending it across the project. It would also be beneficial to have a timescale for implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer needs to outline what their success criteria would be. How many people they would want to get in their community and how they would assess engagement.
There is no timescale for delivery, KPIs or risk assessment so not possible to audit currently.

f6_assessments.q0:
I think I am competent to assess this proposal as I am an active member of the Cardano community and I have 7 years of experience delivering software projects as a QA. 
While I partly agree with the problem statement itself, it's too general, in my opinion, especially when taking into account the solution and implementation, which are written in the same vein. 
I think the problem statement could have been improved by saying something like "Advertising the Cardano ecosystem and Project Catalyst around the world alone may not be sufficient to create community hubs."
Regarding the solution and implementation: I apologize if I am misjudging this, but to me it looks like the proposer attempted to throw everything at the wall and see what sticks afterwards.
"Use challenges to grab our future Cardano users. Summer and after school free online group coding programs." - What challenges? What is the target audience for this initiative? Who will create and guide the online group coding programs?
"Coding and idea challenges for different age groups. Reach out to school districts and youth centers. Have them beta testing projects" - Again, what are the coding and idea challenges referred to here? What projects? Will they be created by the proposer? It is not mentioned in the proposal how this will be done.
Due to the above mentioned reasons and the fact that I can see no metrics for success mentioned anywhere, I strongly disagree this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
For the proposal to receive a higher score, it should be clearer in how the problem will be solved (with concrete steps, not general statements) and by who. Measures of success also need to be added.
f6_assessments.q1:
I do not think this proposal has any chance of being implemented successfully. Here is my assessment:
- The proposer has not provided any details about himself whatsoever and I cannot count "Youth" as relevant experience here
- The proposer has been a member of Project Catalyst only since the 22nd of August, 2021
- I cannot find any previous contributions of the proposer to the Cardano ecosystem
- There are no details in the proposal about who will do what, when and how
- The budget is very large and there is no justification on how it is intended to be used
- Between 22 and 25 August, the proposer has created 7 separate proposals, all suffering from the same issues as this one. This leads me to suspect that the proposals were created en masse in the hopes of gaming the system and obtaining some funds. I apologize if I am wrong.
To make this proposal feasible, the proposer needs to provide more information about himself, about the people who will help him, about what people specifically the proposal targets and how the activities that were mentioned will be organized.
f6_assessments.q2:
I cannot find any information at all that explains how the progress and success of the proposal would be tracked, if it were to be funded.
As such, I completely disagree that the proposal is auditable.
In order for this to be fixed, the proposer needs to provide a clear roadmap describing what will be done when and how, with specific milestones and a time-horizon for the implementation. Along with this, key progress indicators also have to be mentioned.

solution: 中学生から大学生、青少年センターのコーディングチャレンジ。奨学金や賞金もあります。無料のオンライン・コーディング・クラス、実習。
